senses.sense_definition: A large board that displays the score in a game or contest.

examples.text: The fans cheered loudly when the home team's points finally appeared on the <w>scoreboard</w>.
We looked up at the electronic <w>scoreboard</w> to see how much time was left in the match.

senses.sense_definition: A listing of various similar entities along with their properties, such as status or rank.

examples.text: The commission published a digital <w>scoreboard</w> to track the economic performance of member states.
You can view the status of each active process in the system <w>scoreboard</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A taunt which reminds someone that they are losing or have lost.

examples.text: Stop making excuses for your poor performance and look at the results: <w>scoreboard</w>!
He simply yelled "<w>scoreboard</w>" whenever the opposing fans tried to insult him.

traits.comment: used primarily in sports or competitive arguments
